bibl.note: This is a letter from Edward Mitchell to Major General Andrew Jackson, dated May 13, 1815. Mitchell claims that some Chickasaws stole items from his traveling party near Bear Creek.

div1.p: The day that I pasd bare creek Say the 10 the Indians of that Village robd two of Company of a hat & a pistol & Snapt the pistol at one of mens brests then Snatchd a hat of a negro boys head & Carried it of the men came to me Verry Mutch alarmd I talkd to send word he sd that he would have things returned whitch was done by their paying Six bit if Sartch Crimes is these not noticed what will be done next the gods oneley knows you will oblige the travelling by having these things taken notice of by Government I shall notify Col Cocke by the first males
